intro: Panicum didymostachyum, commonly known as the two-stemmed panic grass, is a perennial grass species native to the tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and produces inflorescences that are often described as two distinct, drooping clusters. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to thrive in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value and ability to stabilize soil, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and ecological restoration projects.
